result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernard P. Schuh

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
(2)

2:36 PM Defendant Bernard P. Schuh in court. Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history, Def. has filed petition for Court appointed atty. Court has resent form back to Def. as it was not properly filled out. Def. has not yet received form back. Court questions Def. income. Def. responds and notes take home income is approximately $3,000.00 per month after taxes and deduction. Court will re review paperwork. Def. required to make $450 down payment and then $180.00 monthly payments from there on out. Court orders Def. to make down payment by the end of the week, $180.00 monthly payments to start December 1st, 2022. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Cover Letter RE: Petition for Appointment of Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No contact with victim. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

2:15 PM Defendant Bernard P. Schuh in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish for an Atty. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victim rights, victim did not wish to attend court today. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and No contact with victim. Def. is in agreeance. Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with victim and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
